wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for primary completion rate is the ratio of the female primary completion rate to the male primary completion rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. The primary completion rate indicator is also referred to as gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross intake ratio. Primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross intake ratio. Primary is the ratio of the female gross intake ratio for primary to the male gross intake ratio for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Total is the total number of new entrants to lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of theoretical entrance age to lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Female is the total number of new female entrants to lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of theoretical entrance age to lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Male is the total number of new male entrants to lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of theoretical entrance age to lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for expected primary completion rate
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for expected primary completion rate is the ratio of female expected primary completion rate to the male expected primary completion rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. This indicator is also known as "Gender parity index for expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary."

wb:indicator.wb:name: Pupils of the official school age. Pre-primary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Pre-primary. Total is the total number of pre-primary students who are of the official pre-primary school age. NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private 5A tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5A tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and profession with high skills requirements.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private 5A tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5A tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and profession with high skills requirements.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private 5B tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5B tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are practically oriented/occupationally specific and are mainly designed for participants to acquire the practical skills, and know-how needed for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades. The successful completion of tertiary 5B programmes usually provides the participants with a labor-market relevant qualification.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private 5B tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5B tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are practically oriented/occupationally specific and are mainly designed for participants to acquire the practical skills, and know-how needed for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades. The successful completion of tertiary 5B programmes usually provides the participants with a market-market relevant qualification.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in education. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary education programs.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private ISCED 6 tertiary education institutions. This level is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on course-work only.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private ISCED 6 tertiary education institutions. This level is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on course-work only.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Total is the number of new entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program for the equivalent of at least 200 hours, expressed as a percentage of total number of new entrants to primary grade 1.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Female is the number of new female entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program for the equivalent of at least 200 hours, expressed as a percentage of total number of new female entrants to primary grade 1.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience is the ratio of the female percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Male is the number of new male entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program for the equivalent of at least 200 hours, expressed as a percentage of total number of new male entrants to primary grade 1.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Total is the total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Female is the total number of new female entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the female population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for expected gross primary graduation ratio
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for expected gross primary graduation ratio is the ratio of female expected gross primary graduation rate to the male expected gross primary graduation rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Male is the total number of new male entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the male population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female students. Post-secondary non-tertiary education
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Post-secondary non-tertiary education is the number of female students at the post-secondary non-tertiary education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary education level in a given school year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5A
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5A is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 5A) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 5A) education level in a given school year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5B
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5B is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 5B) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 5B) education level in a given school year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: International (or internationally mobile) students. Tertiary. % Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: International (or internationally mobile) students. Tertiary. % Female is the female share of students who have crossed a national or territorial border for the purposes of education and are now enrolled outside their country of origin.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 6
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 6 is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 6) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 6) education level in a given school year.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in social sciences, business and law is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in social sciences, business and law programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in social sciences, business and law is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in social sciences, business and law programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in science
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in science is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in science is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in agriculture
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in agriculture is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in agriculture programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in agriculture
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in agriculture is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in agriculture programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in services is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in services programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in services
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in services is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in services programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in unspecified and general programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in unspecified and general programmes is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in unspecified and general programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in general and unspecified programmes is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in general and unspecified programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage female teachers. Lower secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Lower secondary is the number of female teachers at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage female teachers. Upper secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Upper secondary is the number of female teachers at the upper secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the upper secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage female teachers. Post-secondary/non-tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Post-secondary/non-tertiary is the number of female teachers at the post-secondary/non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the post-secondary/non-tertiary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates in services. Tertiary. Female is the total number of female tertiary graduates from services programs.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in unspecified programmes. Tertiary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates in unspecified programmes. Tertiary. Total is the total number of tertiary graduates from unspecified programs.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in unspecified programmes. Tertiary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates in unspecified programmes. Tertiary. Female is the total number of female tertiary graduates from unspecified programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in general programmes. Tertiary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates in general programmes. Tertiary. Total is the total number of tertiary graduates from general programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in general programmes. Tertiary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates in general programmes. Tertiary. Female is the total number of female tertiary graduates from general programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduation age population. Primary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduation age population. Primary. Total is the population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the primary school graduation age as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduation age population. Primary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduation age population. Primary. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the primary school graduation age as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduation age population. Primary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduation age population. Primary. Male is the male population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the primary school graduation age as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Pre-primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Pre-primary is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary to male gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Total is the total enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Female is the total female enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Male is the total male enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary). Female is the total female enrollment in primary, secondary and tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of primary school age, secondary school age, and the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary) is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for all levels combined (except pre-primary) to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary). Male is the total male enrollment in primary, secondary and tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of primary school age, secondary school age, and the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes) to the male gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Upper secondary. All programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Upper secondary. All programmes is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for upper secondary (All programmes) to the male gross enrolment ratio for upper secondary (All programmes). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross primary graduation ratio
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross primary graduation ratio is the ratio of the female gross primary graduation rate to the male gross primary graduation rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Total is the number of graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Female is the number of female graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the female population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Total is the number of graduates regardless of age in general programmes of lower secondary education expressed as a percentage of the population at the theoretical graduation age in general programmes of lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Female is the number of female graduates regardless of age in general programmes of lower secondary education expressed as a percentage of the female population at the theoretical graduation age in general programmes of lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Male is the number of male graduates regardless of age in general programmes of lower secondary education expressed as a percentage of the male population at the theoretical graduation age in general programmes of lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Male is the number of male graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the male population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for gross graduation ratio. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross completion ratio. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree is the ratio of female gross completion rate. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross outbound enrolment ratio. Tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross outbound enrolment ratio. Tertiary is the total number of mobile tertiary students coming from a country/region as a percentage of the population of tertiary student age in their home country.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Technical/vocational enrolment in lower secondary (ISCED 2) as % of total enrolment in lower secondary (ISCED 2)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Technical/vocational enrolment in lower secondary (ISCED 2) as % of total lower secondary enrolment (ISCED 2) is the percentage of all lower secondary students enrolled in technical/vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students who are enrolled in lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Technical/vocational enrolment in upper secondary (ISCED 3) as % of total enrolment in upper secondary (ISCED 3)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Technical/vocational enrolment in upper secondary (ISCED 3) as % of total upper secondary enrolment (ISCED 3) is the percentage of all upper secondary students enrolled in technical/vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students who are enrolled in upper secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Youth illiterate population. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. Total is the total number of youth between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Youth illiterate population. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. Female is the total number of females between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Youth illiterate population. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. Male is the total number of males between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adult illiterate population. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. Total is the total number of adults over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adult illiterate population. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. Female is the total number of females over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adult illiterate population. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. Male is the total number of males over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly illiterate population. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. Total is the total number of adults over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly illiterate population. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. Female is the total number of females over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly illiterate population. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. Male is the total number of males over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Youth illiterate population. % female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. % female is the share of the youth illiterate population that is female.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adult illiterate population. % female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. % female is the share of the adult illiterate population that is female.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly illiterate population. % female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. % female is the share of the elderly illiterate population that is female.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for adult literacy rate
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for adult literacy rate is the ratio of female adult literacy rate to the male adult literacy rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Total is the percentage of the population age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Female is the percentage of females age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of female literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for elderly literacy rate
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for elderly literacy rate is the ratio of female elderly literacy rate to the male elderly literacy rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Male is the percentage of males age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of male literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Inbound mobility rate. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Inbound mobility rate. Tertiary. Total is the number of students from abroad studying in a given country, as a percentage of the total tertiary enrollment in that country.

wb:indicator.wb:name: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Primary. Total is the total number of new entrants to primary education who have attended an early childhood care and education (ECCE) program.

wb:indicator.wb:name: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Primary. Female is the total number of new female entrants to primary education who have attended an early childhood care and education (ECCE) program.

wb:indicator.wb:name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education. Total is the number of pupils entering primary education for the first time.

wb:indicator.wb:name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education. Female is the number of female pupils entering primary education for the first time.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Pre-primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Pre-primary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for pre-primary to the male net enrolment rate for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Primary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for primary to the male net enrolment rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Secondary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for secondary to the male net enrolment rate for secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for adjusted net enrolment rate. Primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for adjusted net enrolment rate. Primary is the ratio of female adjusted net enrolment rate for primary to the male adjusted net enrolment rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Total is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Female is the number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Under age (-1). Male is the number of new male entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Total is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Female is the number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Male is the number of new male entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of the primary school entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for net intake rate. Primary.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for net intake rate. Primary is the ratio of female net intake rate for primary to the male net intake rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Total is the total enrolment in primary education of the official primary school entrance age, as a percentage of the population of the same age in a given school year. It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Female is the total female enrolment in primary education of the official primary school entrance age, as a percentage of the female population of the same age in a given school year. It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for adjusted net intake rate. Primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for adjusted net intake rate. Primary is the ratio of the female adjusted net intake rate for primary to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Male is the total male enrolment in primary education of the official primary school entrance age, as a percentage of the male population of the same age in a given school year. It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total is the percentage of the primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is over the official primary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Female is the percentage of the female primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is over the official primary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male is the percentage of the male primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is over the official primary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Outbound mobile students (students from a given country studying abroad). Tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Outbound mobile students (students from a given country studying abroad). Tertiary is the total number of students from a given country studying abroad.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Total is the total number of primary-school-age children who are enrolled in pre-primary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Female is the total number of female primary-school-age children who are enrolled in pre-primary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Male is the total number of male primary-school-age children who are enrolled in pre-primary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Total is the total number of lower secondary school age children who are not enrolled in lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Female is the total number of female lower secondary school age children who are not enrolled in lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school children of lower secondary school age. Male is the total number of male lower secondary school age children who are not enrolled in lower secondary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Outbound mobility ratio (%). Tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Outbound mobility ratio (%). Tertiary is the number of students from a given country studying abroad as a percentage of the total tertiary enrolment in that country.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of private enrolment. Lower secondary. General programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of private enrolment. Lower secondary. General programmes is the enrolment in private lower secondary general programmes expressed as a percentage of total enrolment (public and private) in lower secondary general programmes. 'Private' refers to all educational institutions not operated by a public authority, regardless of whether they receive financial support from public authorities. A high percentage indicates strong involvement of the non-governmental sector (including religious bodies, other organizations, associations, communities, private enterprises or persons) in providing organized educational programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of private enrolment. Lower secondary. Technical/vocational programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of private enrolment. Lower secondary. Technical/vocational programmes is the enrolment in private lower secondary technical/vocational programmes expressed as a percentage of total enrolment (public and private) in lower secondary technical/vocational programmes. 'Private' refers to all educational institutions not operated by a public authority, regardless of whether they receive financial support from public authorities. A high percentage indicates strong involvement of the non-governmental sector (including religious bodies, other organizations, associations, communities, private enterprises or persons) in providing organized educational programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of private enrolment. Upper secondary. General programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of private enrolment. Upper secondary. General programmes is the enrolment in private upper secondary general programmes expressed as a percentage of total enrolment (public and private) in upper secondary general programmes. 'Private' refers to all educational institutions not operated by a public authority, regardless of whether they receive financial support from public authorities. A high percentage indicates strong involvement of the non-governmental sector (including religious bodies, other organizations, associations, communities, private enterprises or persons) in providing organized educational programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of private enrolment. Upper secondary. Technical/vocational programmes
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of private enrolment. Upper secondary. Technical/vocational programmes is the enrolment in private upper secondary technical/vocational programmes expressed as a percentage of total enrolment (public and private) in upper secondary technical/vocational programmes. 'Private' refers to all educational institutions not operated by a public authority, regardless of whether they receive financial support from public authorities. A high percentage indicates strong involvement of the non-governmental sector (including religious bodies, other organizations, associations, communities, private enterprises or persons) in providing organized educational programmes.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Pupil-teacher ratio. Lower secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Lower secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in lower secondary school divided by the number of lower secondary school teachers.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Pupil-teacher ratio. Upper secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Upper secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in upper secondary school divided by the number of upper secondary school teachers.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. All grades. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. All grades. Total is the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. All grades. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. All grades. Female is the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total is the number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Female is the female number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Total is the number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Total is the number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Total is the number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Female

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1.Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for % repeaters. All grades. Primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for % repeaters. All grades. Primary is the ratio of female percentage of repeaters in primary to the male percentage of repeaters in primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in lower secondary. All grades. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in lower secondary. All grades. Total is the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in lower secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of repeaters in all grades of lower secondary education by the total enrolment of lower secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in lower secondary. All grades. Female

It is calculated by dividing the sum of female repeaters in all grades of lower secondary education by the total female enrolment of lower secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Total is the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in upper secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of repeaters in all grades of upper secondary education by the total enrolment of upper secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Female is the number of female students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all female students enrolled in upper secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of female repeaters in all grades of upper secondary education by the total female enrolment of upper secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Male is the number of male students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all male students enrolled in upper secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of male repeaters in all grades of upper secondary education by the total male enrolment of upper secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Total is total number of primary school age children who are enrolled in pre-primary education expressed as a percentage of the total primary school age population.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Female is total number of primary school age females who are enrolled in pre-primary education expressed as a percentage of the female primary school age population.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Male is total number of primary school age males who are enrolled in pre-primary education expressed as a percentage of the male primary school age population.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Total is the number of children of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Female is the number of females of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the female population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Male is the number of males of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Total is the number of children of official lower secondary school age who are not enrolled in lower secondary school expressed as a percentage of the population of official lower secondary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Female is the number of females of official lower secondary school age who are not enrolled in lower secondary school expressed as a percentage of the female population of official lower secondary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Male is the number of males of official lower secondary school age who are not enrolled in lower secondary school expressed as a percentage of the male population of official lower secondary school age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Official entrance age. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Official entrance age. Total is the population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the official entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Official entrance age. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Official entrance age. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the official entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Official entrance age. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Official entrance age. Male is the male population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the official entrance age.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Post-secondary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Post-secondary. Total is the population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to post-secondary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Post-secondary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Post-secondary. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to post-secondary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School age population. Post-secondary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School age population. Post-secondary. Male is the male population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to post-secondary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Total is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Pre-primary. Male is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Total is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to secondary.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to secondary is the ratio of female school life expectancy (primary to secondary) to the male school life expectancy (primary to secondary). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Male is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to tertiary.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to tertiary is the ratio of female school life expectancy (primary to tertiary) to the male school life expectancy (primary to tertiary). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Total is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. wb:indicator.wb:name: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified.
